question: A group of words that state a complete thought.
A sentence that makes a statement.
A sentence that states a command
A sentence that expresses strong feelings
A sentence that asks a question
a group of words that do not state a complete thought
A sentence where two or more independent clauses are joined together without a word to connect them.
two complete sentences joined together by a conjunction and a comma before the conjunction.
a person, place or thing
names a specific person , place or thing using a capital letter
describes or modifies a noun or proper noun
describes more than one of something
used to connect words or phrases in a sentence
shows ownership or possession over something
an action word, or describes a state of being
a part of speech that indicates a noun is present in a sentence
uses a comma after words such as for example, of course,
adjectives listed and separated by a comma
short exclamation, sometimes inserted into a sentence
indicates words are being spoken
shows possession or ownership
when two words are combined, letters are omitted and replaced with an apostrophe
renames something using a comma
when addressing a person or people us a comma after
words that sound the same, but have different meanings and spelling
